intro: Peucedanum medicum, commonly known as the lesser cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with a taproot that is often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves and roots contain various bioactive compounds, including flavonoids and essential oils, which contribute to its medicinal properties. Peucedanum medicum is often found in meadows and woodland edges, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
